articles.description: Has Saturday's 4-1 demolition of West Ham marked the return of the old Manchester City? 'Absolutely not' according to boss Pep Guardiola.
articles.title: Man City 4-1 West Ham: Pep Guardiola says 'old Man City' have definitely not return yet

articles.description: Joao Pedro scored a second-half penalty to put a dent in Arsenal's title hopes as the Gunners were held to a draw by Brighton.
articles.title: Brighton 1-1 Arsenal: Gunners drop points as Joao Pedro takes advantage of William Saliba freak foul

articles.description: Tottenham are enduring a results crisis and an injury crisis - and manager Ange Postecoglou finds himself at the centre of attention.
articles.title: Tottenham 1-2 Newcastle: Can Ange Postecoglou deliver success at Spurs?

articles.description: There have been a number of contributing factors in Newcastle's recent upturn in fortunes, but the scintillating form of star striker Alexander Isak has certainly played a major role.
articles.title: Tottenham 1-2 Newcastle: Alexander Isak 'the best striker in the league' as hot streak continues

articles.description: Ryan Rickelton moves joint-seventh in South Africa's all-time top scorers in a Test innings after hitting 259 in the second Test against Pakistan.
articles.title: South Africa v Pakistan: Ryan Rickelton scores 259 in second Test

articles.description: Barcelona midfielder Dani Olmo and forward Pau Victor have been blocked from playing in the rest of the 2024-25 season by Spain's football authorities.
articles.title: Barcelona: Dani Olmo and Pau Victor registration rejected by La Liga

articles.description: Find out the in depth batting and bowling figures for New Zealand v Sri Lanka in the Men's One Day International Series on BBC Sport.
articles.title: New Zealand v Sri Lanka - Cricket - BBC Sport

articles.description: Saracens respond to a thumping Premiership defeat by Bath to hold off Bristol and end the Bears' record run of wins away from home.
articles.title: Premiership: Saracens 35-26 Bristol - Sarries bounce-back to end Bears' away run

articles.description: Luke Littler has become darts' youngest world champion. BBC Sport looks at the qualities that have taken him to the top.
articles.title: Luke Littler: the mind and the making of darts' youngest world champion

articles.description: Rishabh Pant hits a brilliant 61 but Scott Boland takes 4-42 as India lead Australia by 145 with four wickets left after day two.
articles.title: Australia v India: Rishabh Pant hits 61 but Test finely poised
